Description: Pottery fish dish. Thin dull mid-red slip, quite patchy on interior and exterior around rim, and dribbling towards base; sherd with about one fifth of rim and wall missing; large patch of abrasion on rim.Orange to greyish-red clay with very frequent inclusions of fine mica, grits, quartz and occasional medium-coarse lime.
Curator's comments: Fabric looks imported as not typical for any Egyptian production, though inclusions are consistent with Alexandrian regional production. Parallel from Naukratis in Champaign, Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois (1912.01.0016).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.011)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the museum in 1936. Said to be from Naukratis in the GR register without further details, but therefore possibly from the Egypt Exploration Fund excavations and/or from Flinders Petrie or his associates.
